results.title: Turkey: nation in transition
results.creator_credit: Leroy Leatherman, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Introductory animation reviews the history of Turkey and the Middle East from earliest civilization to the twentieth century. Documentary footage shows life in Turkey today, its political and economic problems and its development as a modern nation with democratic institutions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leroy Leatherman, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: Turkey: emergence of a modern nation
results.creator_credit: Clifford J. Kamen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Reviews the major political and social developments in the Republic of Turkey since its formation in 1923, and shows the influence of cultural traditions dating back to the Greek, Roman and Ottoman empires. Uses map animation to show the relationship between the nation’s geographic position and its strategic position in world affairs. Illustrates the efforts of the Turkish government and people to build a modern, independent industrial nation.

results.title: Turkey: a strategic land and it's people
results.brief_description: The location of Turkey between Asia and Europe and astride Russia’s water route to the Black Sea gives it a strategic political importance. Shows the climatic and geographical features, natural resources and industries in relation to the Turkish people, the beginnings of westernisation as introduced by Ataturk and the continuing changes taking place in modern Turkey.

results.title: Turkey shoot
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, William Fayman, Antony Ginnane and Filmco
results.brief_description: Set in 1995 where criminals are hunted in controlled environments. There is no room for individuality and anyone who dares to be different is thrown into a detention camp for brainwashing where they are tortured and become candidates for manhunts. Cast includes Steve Railsback, Olivia Hussey, Michael Craig and Carmen Duncan.

results.title: Turkey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Families of the world”.
Shows Turkish village life. Girls weave or embroider, and father and mother farm. At day’s end, the family gathers for the evening meal and later to answer the call to prayer. A trip to Instanbul offers a respite from the normal daily routine.

results.title: Turkey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lonely planet: the experience”.
Visitors have long been attracted to Turkey with its unique convergence of three very different worlds - Europe, Asia, and the Middle East. Traveller Justine Shapiro makes her way from the Roman ruins of Ephesus along the Turqoise coast, and then north through the rural Turkish interior to the mountainous Black Sea region.

results.title: Turbulence 2 (Revised version commissioned by ACMI)
results.material_description: interactive touch-screen and computer, colour, software, video and monitor
results.brief_description: Turbulence is an interactive museum of un-natural history where a menagerie of synthesised forms, ‘evolved’ within the computer using a process of artificial selection. It is one of the most awarded and recognised works of Australian multimedia art. The work consists of a touch-screen interface, used to access a virtual museum of evolved electronic creatures. Over 3 years in production, Turbulence is a collection of abstract thoughts, simulations, ideas, information and poetry. A multiplex of links into an interactive web of computer synthesised imagery relating to the philosophical impact of evolution on contemporary thought.
